author: bridge-bot
content:
<nero_eth> That doesn't make sense, imo. Censoring is binary, costs not.
If you're censored from using blobs, the costs of using calldata for DA should be only little more expensive but close to the blob costs.

Also, it's not obvious that a rollup would be sanctioned in the next, say 2 years (we don't even have privacy rollups live yet).
Finally, with a 3m gas limit on the IL, it makes no sense for rollups. 1MB rollup data costs ~16 mio gas. All rollups together, could maximally post ~183 kb per slot, filling the IL with one txs. (re @terencechain: This is why I've been anti raising call data cost for this exact reason)

<terencechain> Another question regarding execution-spec before I sign off...
At `n-2`: My tx `A` lands in IL
At `n-1`: My tx `B` lands in IL, and the previous tx `A `lands in the execution block
At `n`: My tx `B` should land in the execution block as a validity condition but as currently stated in the execution spec, it will get filtered out because `A` is included in the previous block (same address) therefore it's no longer a validity condition. 

I think this is a bug?

- txn B is discarded
